definition: gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: N. Korea charged U. S. reporters with spying.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜以间谍罪起诉美国记者。

sentences.english: He has been accused of spying.
sentences.chinese: 他被控犯有从事间谍罪。

sentences.english: They were charged with espionage or to foreign countries to provide "special services" crime.
sentences.chinese: 他们被控犯有间谍罪或为外国提供“特殊服务”罪。

sentences.english: The 32-year-old freelance journalist was found guilty last month on charges of espionage.
sentences.chinese: 32岁的自由撰稿记者萨贝里上个月被判犯有间谍罪。

sentences.english: The government disclosed that another diplomat had been arrested for spy.
sentences.chinese: 政府透露，又有一名外交官因间谍罪被捕。

sentences.english: The maximum penalty for industrial espionage is 7 years.
sentences.chinese: 商业间谍罪的最高刑期可达7年。

definition: to imprison/to jail/to take into custody
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
